body:
Hi Theodore, Thank you very much for all this. I have run your grasshopper definition.  [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/vtm5j-VOdSneUZGIDNA4qInwKaT3QpW1JGPaBmKH56VvwpVHeQE6vrv3yE2GrBiYrG6P-*YeXFSsPMxhcp35Q1avXlE12OBo/ScreenShot20160909at13.42.57.png)This was the first error I encountered. I then bypassed the humanUI by using boolean toggles into the 'runit' inputs of the rest of the components. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/vtm5j-VOdSlUQw87hldN1P0bpsQglV2onJH*Y0*IXe7s23gTbVFKnwYrR3wAOgIFCTIgNaL4t4gVjNQJiMVRVTLBSUlC2hgF/ScreenShot20160909at13.43.29.png) these  failed to collect data. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/vtm5j-VOdSl0hPYKzFZUmJvpXahjNtnf9XRkQs0avtvYgYlOEcDRFzfdRHAgHp62pvzUNB5-CjyB11uoDjH7O0GpfltjIdH3/ScreenShot20160909at13.47.35.png) All ran well up to Time 1000. However after trying to read the results in different ways it seems that the meshes return one value only. Perhaps it is due to the compression? there isnt any postprocessing subfolder as there used to be in the case folder. There are zipped files in 0,100,200..1000 folders Would you know How can I solve this? Things are getting closer. So excited. Kind Regards,
Olivier
